title: I miss Nexus Blitz. Don't you?
body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WCW4a27M_D8

I loved playing it with my friends, it was hilarious.
All the other gamemodes are dull and boring.

I don't care that it wasnt as popular as Riot expected it to be, I also don't care how buggy it was, If they refine and polish it more it would be as fun as teamfight tactics.

replies.body: Nexus Blitz was literally the only selling point that I could bring to my friends who stopped playing.  But hey, what kind of business would try to retain customers?

Donno how you could compare NB yoo TFT.... too me theirs no competition. Tft ticks me off more than release zoe and yet I still play it during downtime of other games or waiting for friends. I would much rather lose 100 rounds in NB just to play it.
To those who don't like SR/tft and can only stomach so much ARAM it was the best game mode the game ever had (never played ascension or dominion).
ARAM is shitty with bandaid balancing like the 50% ally heal reduction and oracle elixir that makes trap abilities almost useless.

> [{quoted}](name=Salty Mc Feed,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QALNaFwb,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-12-22T19:49:29.359+0000)
>
> ARAM is shitty with bandaid balancing like the 50% ally heal reduction and oracle elixir that makes trap abilities almost useless.

I mean traps are like that in general, use oracle traps shit, don't use oracle traps OP, there's no balance inbetween

It just reduces build diversity and narrows down the amount of champions that are overall useful in ARAM.
In a random mode it really shouldn't be such an issue to have some champions be stronger due to the 5v5 setting.
It's better to have slightly OP champion instead of champions that feel useless.

When you get Soraka in Aram you should be happy, but instead it's like. "I can go full tank, will be better use of my health compared to pressing W, healing nothing and losing 10%." Or you go full damage but it just scales very poorly.

> [{quoted}](name=RekSai CoffeeCo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QALNaFwb,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-12-22T14:15:37.515+0000)
>
> To those who don't like SR/tft and can only stomach so much ARAM it was the best game mode the game ever had (never played ascension or dominion).

More like to those who want to pick their champion but don't want to play rift it was a nice side game mode. The fact that they took away the only other game mode you could pick your champion without replacing it with anything feels super bad. Especially for people who liked to try out new champions on a less intense/competitive game mode.

Odyssey was definitely my favourite. 

Not only was it difficult and tested even the best, it had so much to it. The augments were 100% what made the game mode amazing with all the different ways you could play. It brought me back to the good ol season 4 days before they added the dumb shit like runes reforged and started removing stuff for the sake of money.

The missions that came along with it were also nice, although fuck the fact that some loser could ruin your 2 augments run because he was on a 3 or 4 augments mission.

Dark star thresh, Ascension/Dominion, and Nexus blitz were my next three I think.

I loved odyssey but I think Riot kinda screwed up with the missions. Their matchmaker should have taken missions into account or somehow match people that were on the same mission mostly. Also, it was a bit easier than it should be at 2 augments imo.
Nexus blitz was great, double jungle and all. Really played the mode when I usually only play aram.

Missions ruined the odyssey experience.
The main selling point of odyssey was the amazing augment system, which you could not use because of missions. Most missions (and especially the most challenging missions) were all just "clear with X augments" And to make matters worse you could not do them at the same time. I cleared a run where everybody had 2 augments for the "clear with 4 augments" mission, and then i had to do the 3 augments mission. And then once i did that I had to do the 2 augments one. Which i really already completed but didn't count because of the mission order.
Doing those missions was just a grind of getting people doing the same mission, and surrendering if not. At the end of the day you would spend more time getting in game than playing a game because of it.
Even if you were finally done with those stupid missions yourself, you can't play the highest difficulty with augments because other random people will just instantly surrender when you don't select 2 augments max.
At the end of the day, if you wanted to play with augments you had to play the 2nd highest difficulty, which really wasn't all that difficult.

I personally did not really like Odyssey. I feel like i really could have liked it, but at the end the whole mode felt like nothing but a grind.

You act like you were forced to do the missions instead of just playing to have fun.

I did all the missions and still had plenty of time to enjoy the fuck out of it.

You went in with the wrong mindset from the start for some reason seeing it as a competitive game mode, when it was the complete opposite. I assume you just really wanted those god tier goodie bags like a lot of other people, and I agree I did as well, which is why I went to reddit to find people above gold just to play with me so I didn't have people walking into instant death for no reason.

Missions are what made it fun for me lol. After trying all the enchantments missions were the only thing that kept me interested. Riot should make some kind of "optional" missions and call them "challenges" or something so people don't act so entitled when the mission is too hard for them to beat. Make it easier for them to accept that it's okay if you ignore some missions.

Yeah I think pretty much everyone agrees the mode itself was amazingly fun, Riot just fucked up with the missions by not thinking ahead to the consequences. 

It's very similar to the old runes/masteries, where the only complaint people have were the fact that they cost ip to use, but just like the odyssey issue, it can VERY VERY easily be fixed and would make the game 10x better.

I WAS forced to do the missions. That's the entire point i'm making.
Either you play the mission, or your team surrenders before you can actually start. Just having fun with augments wasn't an option because you could never start a game with them on.
I only saw this a few times, and it was mainly near the end where people were trying their hardest to get the missions before it ended. I had a lot of games where we just had fun.

New Star Guardian mode would be great though. All the new Star Guardians would be great for it (except zoe would be p useless).

I agree, Odyssey was an amazing game mode, it was so much fun.

Nexus Blitz, not so much. It was RNG hell, and it favored a small selection of champions.

The real only problem I had with nexus blitz was the killing spree boost.

Certain people just abused champions non-stop and it made the game very un-fun if you started losing, even VERY slightly.

Other than that though it was interesting and I saw it as a better ARAM than ARAM was, because the fighting was better and more often.

The fighting only happened more often because the arena forced you to fight. It was an absolute slaugterfest in that you couldn't really play what you wanted because certain mini-events would fuck you like a cheap whore unless you were specific champions who excelled at them or at least was able to duel opponents.

>certain mini-events would fuck you like a cheap whore

I don't think you could have thought of a better way to describe it.

Gave me quite a good laugh, thanks.
it took riot at least 2 employees to put in more than 3 hours of work among 2 weeks. thats way too many ressources for riot sorry, modes not coming back.

SR too competitive focused and full of tryhards, tft is stupid and RNG focused where all you have to do is just build glacial, druid/woodland, inferno, or predator and get a easy win, no skill required at all, and Aram is pretty much the only casual mode and it's so annoying when you lose to champ select, cause you got 4 adcs and a ap vs 3 tanks and two assassin's....or even worse, a whole team of poke champions...

#YEEEESS!!

Bring Nexus Blitz back! Please!!

{{sticker:sg-janna}} 

It was such a fun, refreshing alternative to ARAM. And I enjoyed it greatly!
_Especially since my main champion worked great there._ <3
they just needed to do more bug fixing and balancing on the events and rewards.

The mode had some interesting items but other than that... didn't really care about the mode itself. 
Some items were probably OP, but that's what makes it exciting. LUL

I think the reason I liked it so much (and this also applies to URF/ARURF) is that it is a mode where you could pick any champion, absolutely any champion you desire, and go anywhere. You don't have to worry (as much) about lane, role, what is good, etc. SR doesn't have that really. Now that TT has been lost, which was the closest mode there was to offering this, it hurts (the bots just moved to co-op vs. A.I., the OTHER mode that offers this). As a mode, neither NB or URF is really "better" than SR... but at the same time, you can jump in queue, pick whoever, and off you go... and that appeals to me these days, all in the time an SR lobby is abandoned because someone dodged halfway through pick.

ARAM is still great for what it is, but it differs in that it's a one lane teamfight from the start, and you can't pick your champion.

I remember thinking I'd like the very original URF, only to dislike it after two or three rounds. When ARURF came back around last Christmas, I fell in love with it, especially as it came right after NB. I went from not playing League in like 3 years to playing nearly nonstop those few months.  I'd literally be playing a lot if either mode came back.

I do miss it too. Careful the Mods will try to take this down as a RANT even though it's basically a poll to bring it back... They took my post down and it had a poll on it.

Yes, I miss Nexus Blitz. Main reason is plain and simple - shorter queues and games. I always make sure to clear a few HOURS if I want to play League. But when Nexus Blitz was around I could jump in and out any time. I could squeeze a few games before or after work, or before going to bed, etc. Often I don't play League at all because I'm not ready to dive into it for the next 3 hours, but with Nexus Blitz it was much less of a time commitment.
yes

Unpopular opinion, but not really. The only mode I miss is urf. 

It's URF or nothing.

I miss having any game mode aside from SR and ARAM, that actually lets me pick my champion.

Nexus Blitz was alright, but I would rather have Ascension back, because it plays completely different from anything else we currently have. The queue times used to be incredibly short for it and games were quick. You reached full build by the 15 minute mark. How often do you even get to full build in SR before the game is decided? 

Ideally, I wish Dominion would return, but unfortunately most people fail to see the value in such a game mode.
Nexus Blitz was the first non-SR mode that I played and went: "That was really fun, let's go again". ARAM, TT, and URF, just didn't feel as fun to play.
